communications.subject: Acknowledgment Letter 2024-01599
communications.communication:
August 5, 2024                                              REFER TO:  2024-01599 

Mr. Nicholas Estes 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR167963 
Boston, Massachusetts  02115 

Dear Mr. Estes: 

This is to acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated July 7, 2024, and received by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) on July 8, 2024, in which you requested all documents pertaining to former American Indian Movement Leader Carter Camp.  Your request was assigned ATF tracking number 2024-01599.  Please refer to this number in any future communications regarding this request. 

The records you seek require a search in at least one other office within ATF.  Accordingly, your request presents “unusual circumstances” under the FOIA.  See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(iii)(I).  Because of these unusual circumstances, we are extending the time limit to respond to your request by ten additional days, as permitted by the statute.  We have not completed a search to determine whether there are records within the scope of your request.  The time needed to process your request will depend on the complexity of our records search and on the volume and complexity of any records located. 

For your information, this office assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks: simple, complex, or expedited.  Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track.  Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately one month, whereas complex requests necessarily take longer.  Your request was assigned to the Complex track.  It was placed in chronological order based on the date of receipt and will be handled as quickly as possible when it is assigned for processing. 

Because this Office is not assessing any fees in connection with the processing of FOIA requests at this time, there is no need for us to determine whether your request qualifies for a waiver of fees. 

If you have any questions regarding the status of your request, you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison at 202-648-7390.   Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. 

Sincerely, 

Hirsh D. Kravitz 
Acting Chief 
Information and Privacy Governance Division

communications.subject: Update on Your FOIA Request with ATF
communications.communication:
Hello  Nicholas Estes,

Thank you for your continued patience as we process your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request. We are writing to inform you that your request is still open and actively being worked on. We are tracking your request using the original request ID: 2024-01599.

Please note that the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) is currently undergoing a system migration. Starting Sunday, September 22, 2024, we will temporarily lose access to our current system. However, there is no need for concern; our team will continue processing your request during this transition.

You will receive updates about our new system via email from foia-team@atf.gov. If you have any questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at the same email address.

Should your request still be open when the new system is implemented, you will receive a new link to create an account in the updated system, where documents will be shared. If your request is complete, we will notify you through email. Alternatively, if you no longer wish for our office to continue processing your request, please let us know that as well.

For any immediate inquiries, please contact our FOIA Public Liaisons at 202-648-7390.

Thank you for your understanding and support during this transition.

Sincerely,

Hirsh D. Kravitz
Acting Chief
Information and Privacy Governance Division
Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco Firearms and Explosives (ATF)

communications.subject: Important Update: ATF FOIA Requests System Migration
communications.communication:
We are writing to inform you of an important update regarding your FOIA request 2024-01599. The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF) has successfully migrated to a new system, FOIAXpress, and introduced the FOIA Public Access Link (PAL) portal. This portal allows requesters to track their requests, submit new ones, and receive responsive documents securely. 
Please create an account at using the same email address you used to submit your request. Once your account is created, please https://foia-pal.atf.gov (https://foia-pal.atf.gov) notify us via the PAL messaging feature. 
Moving forward: 
 
  *  All FOIA request correspondence must be conducted exclusively through PAL. 
  *  All document releases will be handled via PAL. Email communications for FOIA requests will no longer be processed. 
If you encounter any technical issues or need assistance with PAL, please contact our support team at foia-pal-support@atf.gov 
Thank you for your cooperation as we transition to this improved system. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to continuing to assist you through the ATF FOIA PAL portal. Sincerely, 
ATF FOIA Team

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled (Department of Homeland Security Office of Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All videos, emails, memorandums, reports, and investigations related to the escape of detainees from Delaney Hall on June 12, 2025.  
All complaints about Delaney Hall since May 1, 2025. 
All policies and directives regarding access to counsel at Delaney Hall.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lara S Nochomovitz

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the San Francisco Sunshine Ordinance (established in Chapter 67 of the San Francisco Administrative Code) and California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records.

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the deaths of the following individuals:

- Name: Herbert Watt, Date of birth: 08-08-1964, Date of death: 01-18-2007

- Name: Brandon Carrillo, Date of birth: 03-11-1990, Date of death: 11-30-2012

- Name: Latima Wright, Date of birth: 04-04-1984, Date of death: 06-05-2014

- Name: George Bradford, Date of birth: 06-04-1964, Date of death: 05-29-2014

- Name: Jonathan Mitchell, Date of birth: 03-20-1965, Date of death: 10-10-2014

- Name: Joseph Lilly, Date of birth: 09-12-1994, Date of death: 12-16-2014

- Name: Matthew Hoffman, Date of birth: 10-10-1982, Date of death: 01-04-2015

- Name: Marvin Day, Date of birth: 01-14-1964, Date of death: 07-02-2015

- Name: Filimoni Raiyawa, Date of birth: 07-27-1958, Date of death: 07-30-2015

- Name: Amilcar Perez-Lopez, Date of birth: 07-25-1994, Date of death: 02-26-2015

- Name: Alice Brown, Date of birth: 04-30-1990, Date of death: 03-17-2015

- Name: Herbert Benitez, Date of birth: 10-30-1987, Date of death: 10-15-2015

- Name: Javier Lopez, Date of birth: 05-31-1990, Date of death: 11-11-2015

- Name: Mario Woods, Date of birth: 07-22-1989, Date of death: 12-02-2015

- Name: Jeremy Andrews, Date of birth: 03-02-1985, Date of death: 01-21-2016

- Name: Luis Gongoria, Date of birth: 04-25-1970, Date of death: 04-07-2016

- Name: Jessica Williams, Date of birth: 01-13-1987, Date of death: 05-19-2016

- Name: Robert Bower, Date of birth: 09-18-1963, Date of death: 06-19-2016

- Name: Abel Margo-Carlos, Date of birth: 06-28-1980, Date of death: 03-24-2017

- Name: Christopher Kliment, Date of birth: 11-15-1987, Date of death: 01-05-2019

- Name: Brandon Wiemann, Date of birth: 06-30-1983, Date of death: 03-17-2020

- Name: Kristopher Le, Date of birth: 10-25-2000, Date of death: 01-17-2021

- Name: Kurt Vonboehrens, Date of birth: 08-09-1986, Date of death: 03-16-2022

- Name: Bradley Titus, Date of birth: 09-11-2005, Date of death: 09-08-2022

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx.

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2).

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore.

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to me via email at dillon@muckrock.com, or by phone at (267) 314-7952. Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely,
Dillon Bergin

title: Consumer Complaints for Healthcare Prepayment (NY DFS)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Consumer Complaints for Healthcare Prepayment (NY DFS)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

An opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records of complaints to the Department of Financial Services regarding insurance and/or health care providers from 2015 to 2025 containing any of the phrases “prepay,” “upfront,” “down payment,” “refund,” or “reimbursed,” along with  “prior to necessary medical care,” and “non-emergency procedure.” This includes but is not limited to complaints via DFS’s Healthcare Provider Complaint Form. I wish to receive the records in digital format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tracie McMillan

Thank you so much for your response and explanation of how DFS's database works. We are looking for records for Cigna, Unitedhealth, and Elevance. 

If it is useful context, the purpose for the keyword search was to find records of complaints about providers demanding significant prepayment (i.e. more than the initial copay) for necessary, although not emergency, care, or complaints about delayed refunds after the care has been provided and been run through insurance. 

Please let me know if any further clarification is needed. 

Thanks,
Tracie

RE: FOIL Records Request of June 11, 2025, Reference # R000698-061125 
Dear Tracie McMillan, 
Thank you for providing the additional information regarding your request.  One more question - are you still looking for the timeline of 10 years (i.e., 2015-2025)? 
The Department of Financial Services ("DFS") will provide you with a list of complaints and a code description so that you will have a basic idea of the general category of complaint involved.  I believe the list can provide the dates of complaints that were filed with DFS since 2015, but the actual complaints (the complaint files) prior to 2020 will not be available due to retention and disposition guidelines that call for the disposition of records after six years' time. 
Do you still want the 2015-2025 timeline to apply to your request?  You will be able to see the complaints that were filed with DFS from 2015-2025 from the list, but DFS will not be able to provide any actual records of complaints from 2015-2019. 
Sincerely, 
Sally Geisel 
Principal Attorney 
& Records Access Officer 
NYS Department of Financial Services 
Office of General Counsel

RE: FOIL Records Request of June 11, 2025, Reference # R000698-061125 
Dear Tracie McMillan, 
The NYS Department of Financial Services ("Department") received a FOIL request from you on June 11, 2025. Your FOIL request reads: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

An opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records of complaints to the Department of Financial Services regarding insurance and/or health care providers from 2015 to 2025 containing any of the phrases “prepay,” “upfront,” “down payment,” “refund,” or “reimbursed,” along with “prior to necessary medical care,” and “non-emergency procedure.” This includes but is not limited to complaints via DFS’s Healthcare Provider Complaint Form. I wish to receive the records in digital format. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Tracie McMillan 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-financial-services-6262%252Fconsumer-complaints-for-healthcare-prepayment-ny-dfs-187851%252F%253Femail%253DRecordsaccessofficer%252540dfs.ny.gov&url_auth_token=AAAXQkHa63RlsoiHLnhbpQ4C4v8%3A1uPYFS%3ApUXjv5ehvpv9p9dOLWw-K0Ph1SgjsiAHmsoMtaqj3Mw" 
The Department  has reviewed its files and has located records that are responsive to your request. However, identifying information has been redacted from the records to prevent an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy under N.Y. Public Officers Law Section 87(2)(b) and 89(2)(b). 
N.Y. Public Officers Law Section 87(2)(b) excepts from disclosure records or portions thereof that if disclosed “would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy under the provisions of [Public Officers Law § 89(2)].”  Public Officers Law Section 89(2)(b)(i) prohibits the disclosure of a person’s medical history.  Public Officers Law Section 89(2)(c) offers a cure to complete non-disclosure by redacting identifying details. 
Because the records responsive to your request contain the names and other identifying information of individuals regarding their health care, that information was redacted pursuant to Public Officers Law Section 87(2)(b) to protect their personal privacy. See Hanig v. State of New York Department of Motor Vehicles, 79 N.Y.2d 106 (1992) (“Once it is determined that the requested material falls within a FOIL exemption, no further policy analysis is required.  It is enough that the Legislature has determined to classify the release of such information as an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.”) 
Please log in to the FOIL Records Access Center at the following link to review the responsive records. FOIL Records Request - R000698-061125 
In accordance with Public Officers Law § 89(4), you may appeal this determination to withhold portions of the responsive records within 30 days by completing the Appeals form located on the GovQA portal at Online Appeals Form. 
Sincerely, 
Sally Geisel 
Principal Attorney 
& Records Access Officer 
NYS Department of Financial Services 
Office of General Counsel

title: Rifle inventory records (San Mateo County Sheriff’s Office)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (San Mateo County Sheriff’s Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Hot Rat Summer
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding the "Hot Rat Summer" mural in Cal Anderson Park referenced during the City Council session on 7/9, please provide:
1. Communications including emails, text messages, and Teams chats between City-owned accounts containing the exact phrase "hot rat summer" OR  containing both phrases "rat" AND "mural" since March 1, 2025, including attachments and associated metadata. For Microsoft Teams chats, please include all messages within 1 hour of responsive messages for context.
2. Invoices for work relating to the Hot Rat Summer mural that occurred since March 1, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Nicodemo Scarfo
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

ALL documents mentioning Nicodemo Domenic "Little Nicky" Scarfo (March 8, 1929 – January 13, 2017). This will be the THIRD time I've requested it. DO NOT LIMIT THE RESPONSE TO PREPROCESSED RECORDS. DOING SO WILL BE TAKEN AS AN OUTRIGHT ADMISSION OF DELIBERATE BAD FAITH.

Please and thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires, though you seem quite happy to knowingly break this law by huge, unrepentant margins.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

P.S. 

ACAB

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Superintendent Search Committee
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All questions asked of all candidates during all phases of the search, interview, and selection process for the new superintendent from the start of the recruiting to the date of this request.  At a minimum, this should include all questions asked, orally or in writing, of the the three finalists whom the search committee interviewed during closed session.

While the RESPONSES to those questions may currently be exempt from disclosure under the FOIA, the questions themselves, without connecting them to any candidate responses, should be fully releasable without restriction. Further, whereas the BOV Search Committee committed to transparency, there should be a record of all questions asked (written or oral) for transparency.

Given that the interviews were just conducted, the records responsive to this request should be immediately available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

Virginia Military Institute ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-114: The Virginia Freedom of Information Act § 2.2-3704 B. requires that "a request for public records shall identify the requested records with reasonable specificity." Your request does not ask for specific records. Rather, it asks for information shared during a closed session of a Board of Visitors committee. Please revise your request to provide the specificity required by law. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Virginia Military Institute.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request ##25-114
communications.communication:
In any normal, open, and transparent search and hiring process, the search committee and interviewees develop goals and objectives for the traits to evaluate candidates against. If a process is truly fair and balanced, there is a set of questions that all candidates are asked. Then, the freewheeling questions may follow during discussion, which may or may not be captured.

A review of previously released documents about VMI hiring shows that for the last Superintendent Search and the last two Commandant Searches, this practice was followed, and all standard questions were eventually made public (some through FOIA). In addition, while deliberations are protected in closed sessions, there is no reasonable expectation of protection for the a list of the topics the candidates were asked about and the questions they were asked, especially when this request is for the questions themselves and neither responses nor who they were directed to is requested.

of all candidates during all phases of the search, interview, and selection process for the new superintendent from the start of the recruiting to the date of this request. At a minimum, this should include all questions asked, orally or in writing, of the the three finalists whom the search committee interviewed during closed session.

Again, "the questions themselves, without connecting them to any candidate responses, should be fully releasable without restriction" for the search committee and BOV members.

If "records do not exist" for standard topics and questions for all candidates, it means VMI is stipulating that neither the search committee nor the BOV itself had any standard lines of inquiry put to the three finalists so as to assess their responses against each other on essential topics used in the final evaluation and selection.  That would be the definition of an arbitrary and capricious evaluation and selection process.

If, however, VMI chooses to state that it refuses to disclose what these standard questions were, then this is another issue and has the effect of saying that the public does not have the right (in VMI's view) to know the priorities used in the selection process.

I trust this clarifies the scope. If not, please let me know.

Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Virginia Military Institute.

Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Delaware Public School Teacher Salaries (2018-2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Annual electronic listing of all employees of the Delaware Public School System from January 01, 2018 to December 31, 2024. Specifically, I am seeking electronic payroll/salary information for all individuals employed within all public schools and their districts for all fiscal years during this period. 

For each year and payroll, I am seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) [not paper records or a PDF created from data] with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, date of birth or age, job title and code, subjects taught, school level (K-12, kindergarten, etc.), teaching certificates, measure of teaching quality (teacher evaluations of value-added of teacher), employment status (full-time/part-time/leave of absence), hire date or years of experiences, termination date, contract type (contracted/regular/temporary/student employee), and gross annual salary. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables. 

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if school districts or job titles are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so. 

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc). 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Kaleb Houle-Lawrence.

title: Consumer Complaints for Healthcare Prepayment (Ohio AG)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Consumer Complaints for Healthcare Prepayment (Ohio AG)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records of consumer complaints from 2015 to 2025 about healthcare providers, doctors, hospitals, or surgical centers containing any of the phrases “prepay,” “upfront,” “down payment,” “refund,” “reimbursed,” “prior to necessary medical care,” and “non-emergency procedure.” This includes but is not limited to complaints via the OH Attorney General’s online complaint form.  I am requesting this search in order to find complaints about providers demanding significant prepayment (i.e. more than the initial copay) for necessary, although not emergency, care and/or not providing a refund of the excess amount prepaid. I wish to receive the records in digital format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Tracie McMillan

title: Records Request: Investigation Files and Actions by Heather Stertz

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Records Request: Investigation Files and Actions by Heather Stertz
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to Wisconsin’s Open Records Law (Wis. Stat. § 19.31-19.39), I am formally requesting all records, communications, and documents related to the work conducted by Heather Stertz concerning Alexander, Tanya, Lincoln, Milania, and Liam Lennon from May 15, 2023, to the present.

Specifically, I am seeking:

Case notes and reports from any investigations involving these individuals.
Communications between Heather Stertz and law enforcement or any other agency concerning these cases.
Emails, text messages, or memos reflecting recommendations made by Heather Stertz.
Internal records and decision-making documents tied to the CPS investigation.
Documentation of any delays or actions taken regarding charging recommendations.
This information is critical to ensure accountability and transparency regarding the handling of investigations involving these individuals and to assess the integrity of the findings. If any part of the requested information is withheld or redacted, please provide a written explanation citing the specific exemptions relied upon.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Please acknowledge receipt of this request within 10 business days. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,

Alex Lennon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Records Request: Investigation Files and Actions by Heather Stertz
communications.communication:
Dear Constance J. Vanderhoef,

Thank you for your response and for outlining the confidentiality laws that govern the requested records.

As a family member directly affected by these cases and investigations, I believe I meet the criteria under Wis. Stat. § 19.35 and relevant statutory exceptions to access the requested records. This request is made to ensure transparency and accountability in the handling of investigations involving my family members. Specifically, I am concerned about the potential for misconduct, including whether Heather Stertz may have been involved in covering up fraud related to FoodShare, BadgerCare, childcare, and unemployment benefits. It is vital to assess the integrity of the findings to address any potential harm caused by improper handling.

I will promptly complete and return the release of information form to fulfill your procedural requirements. If any part of the requested records is withheld or redacted, I respectfully request a written explanation citing the specific exemptions relied upon.

Should you require any further information to process my request, please do not hesitate to contact me back via Muckrock.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

Sincerely,
Alex Lennon

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of recognized student organizations (i.e., the list available here: https://cometmail.sharepoint.com/:l:/s/StudentOrganizationCenterSP/FGKgAgaIle9Hl-cp3tcnU-sBBReCpMLhZVo0Q8ww4jTTJw?e=hTteTS).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: List of student organizations
communications.communication:
Dear Adam Steinbaugh,
This correspondence relates to your request for information received by The University of Texas at Dallas (“UT Dallas”). UT Dallas responds in a timely manner.

You can find the list of currently recognized organizations uploaded here<https://utdallas.box.com/s/vfihwqvt1nkutd8gjnfotm1auod2n7yf>. Please note that this list is fluid as an organization can be registered today and inactive next week for various reasons. Please make sure to download the file prior to the link expiration date of November 20, 2025. This closes your request for public information.

Thank you,

Vanessa Balderrama
Office of Legal Affairs
The University of Texas at Dallas
800 W. Campbell Rd, AD35
Richardson, TX 75080

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FDA on lecanemab
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

July 15, 2025
Food and Drug Administration
Division of Freedom of Information (HFI-35)

RE:  Freedom of Information Act request

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, I am requesting all FDA FAERS case  reports, including the narrative and summary reports on the two drugs below:
1.)  lecanemab aka: lecanemab-IRMB or Leqembi  for all times up to the most recent entries.
2.)  donanemab, aka donanemab-AZBT or Kisunla for all times up to the most recent entries.

I'm also requesting case report number 24075739 regarding a patient on lecanemab who experience “confusion”.

I am a professional journalist writing on commission for The BMJ and The Lever.
 
As an investigative journalist, I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this FOIA request and duplicating responsive records.  

Thank you for your attention to this request.

Sincerely,


Jeanne Lenzer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeanne Lenzer

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: FDA on lecanemab
communications.communication: RE: FOIA request above of 7/15/2025 - when i cloned an earlier request i failed to include my outlets: I'm writing on commission for The BMJ and LeverNews.

title: Driver License History Research - Record Retention Policy Analysis

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Driver License History Research - Record Retention Policy Analysis
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

CONNECTICUT DMV REQUEST


Requesting driver license history and related records for Justin T Kashuba formerly of Derby and or Seymour CT, covering all available time-frames from original license and per permit issuance (approximately 1992-1993) through 1995.


**Records requested include:**

- Driver license applications and renewals
- Driving record and violation history if any
- Address documentation 
- Current retention policy for historical records


**Privacy Protection Request:**
Please redact date of birth and SSN if present from provided records while maintaining document integrity for research purposes. Research requires record content but not personal identifying information such as DOB and SSN.

**This request serves academic research into government record retention practices and interstate mobility documentation.**

**If records from the 1990s are no longer retained due to policy limitations, requesting available documentation from earliest retained period.


**Fee waiver requested for academic research into government record-keeping practices and institutional transparency and reasons listed below.**

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

communications.subject: Re: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Driver License History Research - Record Retention Policy Analysis
communications.communication:
Good morning,

This is to acknowledge receipt of your request under the Freedom of Information Act.   The Department of Motor Vehicles will determine whether the requested documents exist in its records and provide you with copies of all non-exempt documents within a reasonable period of time.  If there are fees in excess of $10.00 associated with this request, the Department will contact you with the payment amount prior to releasing the documents.

Thank you,
Connecticut Department of Motor Vehicles
Legal Services Division

communications.subject: RE: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Driver License History Research - Record Retention Policy Analysis
communications.communication:
Dear Connecticut Department of Motor Vehicles, 

thank you for your acknowledgement and your efforts to attempt to locate these records. I'm grateful to have grown up in Connecticut and to have obtained my drivers licence there. 

However there was a slight ERROR in the request pertaining to fee waiver. I am conducting research but it likely does not technically qualify as academic research. 

Please waive the fee if possible and if not then contact with any fee over 10 dollars as you noted. 

I'm very sorry about the error. This was a template that I copied and pasted and made some quick adjustments to without due consideration to the academic research technical qualifications of fee waiver. I'm sorry about that mistake. 

Thank you so much again.

Sincerely, 

Justin Kashuba

communications.communication:
Good morning, Justin Kashuba-



We are in receipt of your Freedom of Information Act request dated June 11, 2025, in which you requested the following:


CONNECTICUT DMV REQUEST

Requesting driver license history and related records for Justin T Kashuba formerly of Derby and or Seymour CT, covering all available time-frames from original license and per permit issuance (approximately 1992-1993) through 1995.


**Records requested include: **

- Driver license applications and renewals

- Driving record and violation history if any


  *
Please be advised, the foregoing requested information is not a FOIA request but may be obtained via a Form J-23 which I have attached to this email for your convenience.



- Address documentation

  *
Please be advised, this request is exempt under FOIA, please see C.G.S. 1-210.


- Current retention policy for historical records

  *
Please follow the link to the DMV retention records policy: Record Retention Periods<https://portal.ct.gov/dmv/resources/record-retention-periods?language=en_US> or Agency Specific Schedules<https://portal.ct.gov/csl/departments/public-records/state-program/agency-specific-schedules?language=en_US>



This information concludes the department's obligation under FOIA, should you require further documentation, please submit another request at: https://dasct.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(tnz1gszq3grctg4554n1boe5))/supporthome.aspx.aspx<https://dasct.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(tnz1gszq3grctg4554n1boe5))/supporthome.aspx>

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Roster (Jacksonville Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: Library Contract Request: HeinOnline database (Michigan State University) (Lansing Community College)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Library Contract Request: HeinOnline database (Michigan State University) (Lansing Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with William S. Hein & Co. relating to the licensing of the “HeinOnline” database;
2) All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
3) All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with William S. Hein & Co. for the “HeinOnline” database. 

Please do not limit your search to strictly direct agreements or renewals between the institution and William S. Hein & Co., but include any agreements and related documentation through consortia such as the Midwest Collaborative for Library Services (MCLS), the Big Ten Academic Alliance (BTAA), or Lyrasis.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of the “HeinOnline” database.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ellen Dubinsky

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

In August 2024 I submitted a records request for all documents related to the James Scandirito case (Request Number: 2024-5808). I was quoted a rough estimate of $400 for the digital evidence on 6/25/2024, but at the time I declined to move forward with the digital evidence portion and the request was closed. I would now like to move forward with digital evidence and I'm writing to request an invoice. Also, would it be possible for me to get an index or list of contents for the digital evidence portion, so I would know in advance what it will contain? Is there any other material in this case? Would the State's Attorney's office be able to help me with further discovery documents?
Many thanks for your help,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Mikita Brottman

communications.subject: Boca Raton PD JustFOIA#2025-9180
communications.communication:
Good morning,
This email is in response to your public records request received by the City on 8/18, "...I would now like to move forward with digital evidence and I'm writing to request an invoice. Also, would it be possible for me to get an index or list of contents for the digital evidence portion, so I would know in advance what it will contain? Is there any other material in this case?..."

An initial estimate of the costs and special service charges (for extensive use of information technology resources and extensive clerical and supervisory assistance) for the time required to search for, identify, compile, and potentially redact the responsive records is as follows:
*       Evidence Personnel, 1 hours at $38.50 per hour;
*       Initial review: 1 audio, 1,839 photos, 10 videos totaling over 4 hours of footage (see invoice for notes);

The total estimated special service charge in connection with your request is $77.00.  An invoice is attached regarding the total invoice amount.
Upon receipt of the estimated charges, payable through the JustFOIA portal, the City will continue to process your records request. These estimated charges will be adjusted based upon the actual time spent in identifying, compiling, and potentially redacting the requested records. If the actual costs are determined to be less than the estimated costs, the difference will be refunded to you. If the actual costs are higher than the estimated costs, we will contact you and provide the additional cost information.
To pay online with a credit card, click here https://bocaratonfl.justfoia.com/publicportal (your Security Key # 0AD3AE3A, Request # 2025-9180 will be required). You will be redirected to a separate site to submit credit card information and will receive your receipt for payment via email.
In compliance with the Public Records Act, the City has used good faith and reasonable efforts to review and assess your request and develop the estimates provided herein. If you believe that we have misunderstood the scope and/ or nature of your request, please contact us to provide clarification so that we may correctly estimate the service charges and costs in connection with a modified search.


[X]
Raven Doyle  |  Multimedia Evidence Custodian
City of Boca Raton, Field Services Division
100 NW 2nd Ave, Boca Raton, FL 33432
P  561-338-1341  |  rdoyle@bocaraton-fl.gov<mailto:rdoyle@bocaraton-fl.gov>

Stay connected with us on social media!<http://www.myboca.us/stayconnected>


Please note: Florida has a very broad public records law. Most written communications to or from local officials regarding city business are public records, and are available to the public and media upon request. Your e-mail communications may therefore be subject to public disclosure.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Mariposa County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

title: EPD Contracts and Agreements with Flock Safety

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: EPD Contracts and Agreements with Flock Safety
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of any contracts, purchase agreements, service agreements, or memorandums of understanding (MOUs) between the Eugene Police Department and Flock Safety from January 1, 2023 to present.
This includes documentation related to the acquisition, leasing, or use of Flock Safety cameras or services, including data platforms or analytics tools.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kim Crooks

communications.subject: Eugene Police Department  - Police Department Records Request EPD-2025-3487: Completed
communications.communication:
Dear Kim Crooks, 
  
 The request Request Number: EPD-2025-3487 has been completed. Please click on the request link to download the response documentation. 
  
 The City has conducted a reasonable search and identified a software services contract and a memorandum of understanding between Eugene Police Department and Flock Safety ALPR Services responsive to your request. 
  
 The records have been previously pulled for a similar request and there is no charge for the records being provided today. 
  
 If an exemption has been asserted to your request, you may seek review of that decision pursuant to ORS 192.415. 
  
   
  
 Thank you, 
  
 Eugene Police Department

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: New Hampshire Right to Know Law Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

title: Mr Robert E. Chasen FBI Service and Lifetime Communication Records (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mr Robert E. Chasen FBI Service and Lifetime Communication Records (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The service records of the late Robert E. Chasen, former FBI agent and Commissioner of U.S. Customs under President Carter from 1977-1980: born 7/3/1916, died 9/25/2005. In addition I request the records of any direct communications between either the FBI, the CIA or the NSA and Mr Robert E. Chasen after he left the FBI throughout his lifetime, outwith his time of appointment as Commissioner of U.S. Customs.
Obituary: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/tcpalm/name/robert-chasen-obituary?id=26502498

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick Mockridge

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1555647-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Massachusetts Department of Correction (Central Office))

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Massachusetts Department of Correction (Central Office))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma
